message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about dog behavior and hunting instincts. Dogs have a keen sense of smell and hearing, which allow them to sense and locate their prey. Option (D) is unrelated to hunting as well and suggests a desire to play rather than hunt. Only option (C) mentions the ability of a hunting dog to tell where its victim, or prey, is located.
